article.headline: Alabama A&M 84, Alcorn State 73
article.story: HUNTSVILLE, Ala. (AP) -- Obie Trotter scored 29 points and tied Alabama A&M's record for career steals to lead the Bulldogs to an 84-74 victory over Alcorn State on Monday night. Alabama A&M (9-12, 7-7 Southwestern Athletic Conference) hit 14-of-18 free throws in the final nine minutes to pull out the win and break a three-game losing streak. Trotter had three steals to tie a school record 330 steals set by Desmond Cambridge. Michael Ford added 22 points and Marcus Jones followed with 13 to round out the Bulldogs' double-digit scoring. Delvin Thompson led Alcorn (6-18, 6-9) with 30 points while Clif Douglass added 16 and Patrick Horton followed with 11 points. It was the third straight loss for the Braves, who shot 45 percent from the field in the game and 61.9 percent from the free throw line. Alabama A&M trailed by as many as 14 in the first half, but went on an 18-4 run in the final four minutes to tie the score 39-39 at halftime.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
